columns.name: name
columns.description: A friendly name that identifies an Alert management service.

columns.name: id
columns.description: Azure resource ID.

columns.name: type
columns.description: Type of the resource.

columns.name: sort_order
columns.description: Sort order of the alert management.

columns.name: sort_by
columns.description: Sort the query results by input field, default value is 'lastModifiedDateTime'.

columns.name: custom_time_range
columns.description: Filter by custom time range in the format <start-time>/<end-time> where time is in (ISO-8601 format).

columns.name: time_range
columns.description: Filter by time range. Possible values are '1h', '1d', '7d' or '30d'.

columns.name: severity
columns.description: Severity of alert Sev0 being highest and Sev4 being lowest. Possible values include: 'Sev0', 'Sev1', 'Sev2', 'Sev3', 'Sev4'.

columns.name: signal_type
columns.description: The type of signal the alert is based on, which could be metrics, logs or activity logs. Possible values include: 'Metric', 'Log', 'Unknown'.

columns.name: alert_state
columns.description: Alert object state, which can be modified by the user. Possible values include: 'AlertStateNew', 'AlertStateAcknowledged', 'AlertStateClosed'.

columns.name: monitor_condition
columns.description: Can be 'Fired' or 'Resolved', which represents whether the underlying conditions have crossed the defined alert rule thresholds. Possible values include: 'Fired', 'Resolved'.

columns.name: target_resource
columns.description: Target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

columns.name: target_resource_name
columns.description: Name of the target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

columns.name: target_resource_type
columns.description: Resource type of target ARM resource, on which alert got created.

columns.name: monitor_service
columns.description: Monitor service on which the rule(monitor) is set. Possible values include: 'ApplicationInsights', 'ActivityLogAdministrative', 'ActivityLogSecurity', 'ActivityLogRecommendation', 'ActivityLogPolicy', 'ActivityLogAutoscale', 'LogAnalytics', 'Nagios', 'Platform', 'SCOM', 'ServiceHealth', 'SmartDetector', 'VMInsights', 'Zabbix', 'ResourceHealth'.

columns.name: alert_rule
columns.description: Rule(monitor) which fired alert instance. Depending on the monitor service, this would be ARM ID or name of the rule.

columns.name: source_created_id
columns.description: Unique ID created by monitor service for each alert instance. This could be used to track the issue at the monitor service, in case of Nagios, Zabbix, SCOM, etc.

columns.name: smart_group_id
columns.description: Unique ID of the smart group.

columns.name: smart_grouping_reason
columns.description: Verbose reason describing the reason why this alert instance is added to a smart group.

columns.name: start_date_time
columns.description: Creation time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance.

columns.name: last_modified_date_time
columns.description: Last modification time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance.

columns.name: monitor_condition_resolved_date_time
columns.description: Resolved time(ISO-8601 format) of alert instance. This will be updated when monitor service resolves the alert instance because the rule condition is no longer met.

columns.name: last_modified_user_name
columns.description: User who last modified the alert, in case of monitor service updates user would be 'system', otherwise name of the user.

columns.name: context
columns.description: The context of the alert management.

columns.name: egress_config
columns.description: The egress config for the context management.

columns.name: title
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionTitle

columns.name: resource_group
columns.description: ColumnDescriptionResourceGroup
